Package parser.facades

Class TrainingModelFacade

java.lang.Object
parser.facades.TrainingModelFacade
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataHolder<java.lang.String>
public class TrainingModelFacade
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataHolder<java.lang.String>
A class that implements the DataHolder interface. Once the readLabels method is called a new TrainingModel is instantiated. This training model receives the labels passed as parameters to the readLabels method. Every time the readClass method is invoked, the trainingModel.updateModel is invoked with the data passed as argument to the readClass method. This class is a facade ("a middle man") that makes the interface between receiving data from some source, for example a csv file and obtaining a DataModel with useful counts from that data.
Since:
2020-05-03
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Marcelo Jacinto, David Souto, Gonçalo Tomás
See Also:
DataHolder, DataModel, TrainingModel

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public void readData​(java.lang.String[] data)
      A method that when called, receives an array of String as parameters, and call the method DataModel.updateModel() on the DataModel previously instantiated using the readLabel() method. This method assumes that the method readLabels was invoked at least once. If not, the DataModel was not instantiated and the data being passed to this method is ignored.
      Specified by:
      readData in interface DataHolder<java.lang.String>
      Parameters:
      data - An array of String with features and a class
      Throws:
      EmptyStringException - if the array of String was empty

    • readLabels

      public void readLabels​(java.lang.String[] data)
      A method that when called, receives an array of String with labels for the data. These labels are used to instantiate a new TrainingModel, ignoring the last element of the data array.
      Specified by:
      readLabels in interface DataHolder<java.lang.String>
      Parameters:
      data - An array of String with labels and a class label
      Throws:
      EmptyStringException - if the array of String was empty

    • getTrainingModel

      public DataModel<java.lang.String> getTrainingModel()
      Method that return the DataModel object created and updated after using the methods readLabels and readData.
      Returns:
      returns a datamodel.DataModel with updated counts
      See Also:
      DataModel, TrainingModel
